tactics.name: Avoid Category Redundancy
tactics.description: Do not use keywords already present in your book's category to avoid wasting KDP box space.
steps: Use category-specific phrases in KDP boxes
caveats: May fail if category keywords are insufficient
source_quotes: don't waste one of your KDP box phrases on a word or phrase that is already in the category string

tactics.name: Avoid HTML Code
tactics.description: Exclude HTML code from KDP keywords to prevent system errors and ensure compliance.
caveats: May cause flagging if not removed
source_quotes: HTML which is a form of web code...systems could penetrate from the inside

tactics.name: Avoid Quotations and HTML
tactics.description: Amazon's new keyword rules prohibit the use of quotations and HTML to prevent formatting issues
caveats: When products fail to meet review count thresholds

heuristics.name: Review Count Threshold
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize boosting category keyword optimization
source_quotes: Amazon will remove you from the category if you don't use specific category phrases

claims.statement: Amazon prohibits subjective quality claims and time-sensitive statements in keywords.
source_quotes: Amazon doesn't want authors making Amazon search results make a claim of quality of a book

claims.statement: Amazon penalizes products using HTML in keywords

niche_patterns.description: Niche targeting combines audience identity, specific issues, and limiting factors for precision.
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Leverages low competition and targeted keyword opportunities in underserved markets.
source_quotes: Amazon doesn't want a different format of a book showing up in the search results for some other search phrase
